goal.ch:
This course aims to discuss the tools of analyzing financial time series.
This course begins by introducing students to the fundamental concepts of time series
econometrics, followed by an exploration of various tools for addressing forecasting challenges.
This course also examines practical applications of forecasting in empirical asset
pricing and macroeconomics.
goal.en:
This course aims to discuss the tools of analyzing financial time series.
This course begins by introducing students to the fundamental concepts of time series
econometrics, followed by an exploration of various tools for addressing forecasting challenges.
This course also examines practical applications of forecasting in empirical asset
pricing and macroeconomics.

outline.ch:
Week Date Topics
1 2/20 Course Policy + Statistical Properties of Time Series
2 2/27 Unit Root and ARMA
3 3/6 Application (I): CAPM and Return Predictability
4 3/13 Application (II): Anomaly Zoo
5 3/20 Volatility Modeling: ARCH and GARCH
6 3/27 Bayesian Econometrics and Learning Problems
7 4/3 Spring Break, No Class
8 4/10 Midterm Exam
9 4/17 Model Selection
10 4/24 Vector Autoregressions (VAR)
11 5/1 Forecasting in Data-Rich Environment: Dynamic Factor Model
12 5/8 Forecasting in Data-Rich Environment: Principal Component Analysis
13 5/15 Forecast Combinations
14 5/22 Forecasting under Model Instability
15 5/29 Machine Learning Methods
16 6/5 Application (III): Forecasting Exchange Rates
outline.en:
Week Date Topics
1 2/20 Course Policy + Statistical Properties of Time Series
2 2/27 Unit Root and ARMA
3 3/6 Application (I): CAPM and Return Predictability
4 3/13 Application (II): Anomaly Zoo
5 3/20 Volatility Modeling: ARCH and GARCH
6 3/27 Bayesian Econometrics and Learning Problems
7 4/3 Spring Break, No Class
8 4/10 Midterm Exam
9 4/17 Model Selection
10 4/24 Vector Autoregressions (VAR)
11 5/1 Forecasting in Data-Rich Environment: Dynamic Factor Model
12 5/8 Forecasting in Data-Rich Environment: Principal Component Analysis
13 5/15 Forecast Combinations
14 5/22 Forecasting under Model Instability
15 5/29 Machine Learning Methods
16 6/5 Application (III): Forecasting Exchange Rates

textbook.ch:
You do not need to buy the textbook. However, some helpful references related
to this course are as follows,
– Graham Elliott and Allan Timmermann, (2016), “Economic Forecasting“, Princeton
University Press.
– James D. Hamilton, (1994), “Time Series Analysis“, Princeton University Press.
– John Y. Campbell, Andrew W. Lo and A. Craig MacKinlay, (1996), “The Econometrics
of Financial Markets“, 2nd Edition, Princeton University Press.
– Edward Greenberg, (2014), “Introduction to Bayesian Econometrics“, 2nd Edition,
Cambridge University Press.
– Stefan Nagel, (2021), “Machine Learning in Asset Pricing“, Princeton University Press.
textbook.en:

flexDiscription.ch: 第17週與18週開放自行線上學習與討論研究提案。學生附有初步研究結果的研究提案應於第17週前繳交，並且預計在第18週獲得回饋。
flexDiscription.en: Weeks 17 and 18 are for online learning and discussions of the research proposal. Students are expected to submit their research proposal with their results of preliminary analysis by the end of Week 17 and receive the feedback in Week 18.
